abstract: From a collection of 16mm film of migrant life in Victoria in the 1950s to the 1970s, by Tony Agapitos. This shows a celebration of National Day of the Greek Community 25th March 1966 at the Olympic Swimming Pools.
description: Tony Agapitos was a Greek immigrant and film-maker who documented aspects of life in the Greek community in Melbourne during the 1950s to the 1970s. He focused on significant political, social and religious events, including the arrival of Greek ships at Victoria docks, celebrations and dances, protest marches, political meetings and religious occasions. ACMI holds all of the known footage shot by Agapitos. The material comprises approximately three hours of footage and was shot on 16mm and 35mm film.  This short film shows a celebration of National Day of the Greek Community 25th March at the Olympic Swimming Pools.  On this same day, the Greek Bishop held the National Day at Festival Hall (separately).
